result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary R Bretzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 56 days credit if revoked.
Sentence is to run Consecutive to 20CM121 and any other present sentences

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Any valid prescriptions must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No violent contact with Victim A.

Case 2020CM1959 is Dismissed and read-in.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 2:36 PM
Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Zachary R Bretzel in court, in custody, with attorney Kyle E Jesinski. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2, 3, and 4 are dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
90-Days Jail
Credit time 56-days, if Revoked
Sentence is to run Consecutive to 20CM121 and any other present sentences.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent contact with: Victim A

COSTS:  $243.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:44 AM Defendant Zachary R Bretzel in court, in custody, with attorney Kyle E Jesinski.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jesinski requests a date for plea and sentencing stating there is a chance the newest matter may not yet resolve.  The Court will set all three cases for plea and sentencing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachary R Bretzel
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2022)
Prior: 505 Merton Ave Apt 1, Hartland, WI 53029

01:57 PM Defendant Zachary R Bretzel in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Menden states the defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
